notes.text:
This update for gstreamer-0_10-plugins-bad fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-9445, CVE-2016-9446: Protection against buffer overflows (bsc#1010829)
- CVE-2016-9447: Disable the nsf plugin (bsc#1010514)

notes.text: Integer overflow in the vmnc decoder in the gstreamer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via large width and height values, which triggers a buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The vmnc decoder in the gstreamer does not initialize the render canvas, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information as demonstrated by thumbnailing a simple 1 frame vmnc movie that does not draw to the allocated render canvas.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The ROM mappings in the NSF decoder in gstreamer 0.10.x allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read or write) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted NSF music file.
